result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kerry L Milton was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Kerry L Milton was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kerry L Milton in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files amended information amending count 1 to a misdemeanor charge of Possession of THC. Defendant pleas guilty to the amended charge in count 1 and pleas guilty as to count 2 of the criminal complaint. Count 3 is dismissed outright. Court imposed the following sentence:  

Count 1:  
15 days jail with huber concurrent to count 2. Sentence to commence today by 6 pm.   Court costs of $243.00 plus the DNA surcharge of $200.00.  Apply any bail that is posted.  Defendant to pay $100.00 a month commencing 05/01/2015 and every month thereafter.   Alternate 8 days jail to run consecutive.

Count 2
90 days jail with huber. Sentence to commence today by 6 pm. 
fine of $1379.00
Blood Draw fee of $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police Department. 
$8.00 for the cost of the transcript fee
VIP already done
12 month revocation of driver's license
IID 12 months

Defendant to pay $100.00 a month commencing 05/01/2015 and every month thereafter. Apply any bail that is posted. Alternate jail is stated in count 1.

Defendant Kerry L Milton in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense withdraws Motion. Attorney Bayer requests new motion to be heard. Court addresses Motion to Suppress.  Defense requests speedy trial.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED

Absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not consume alcohol and not possess other than at work and for work related reasons. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring within 1 business day.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program including random urine screens.  Defendant to have no contact with the PDQ store listed in criminal complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Kerry L Milton in court with attorney John T Bayer.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files exhibit #1 Amended Judgment of Conviction, marked and received. Officer Phillips from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. Court declares the testimony closed. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
